com.nimbusds.openid.connect.http
Class HTTPRequest

java.lang.Object
  com.nimbusds.openid.connect.http.HTTPRequest

public class HTTPRequest
extends java.lang.Object

HTTP request with support for all parameters required to construct an OpenID Connect request message.

Version:
0.9 (2012-05-11)
Author:
Vladimir Dzhuvinov

Nested Class Summary

          Enumerates the HTTP methods used in OpenID Connect requests.

Constructor Detail

HTTPRequest

public HTTPRequest(HTTPRequest.Method method)
Creates a new minimally specified HTTP request.

Parameters:
method - The HTTP request method. Must not be null.

HTTPRequest

public HTTPRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest sr)
            throws java.io.IOException
Creates a new HTTP request from the specified HTTP servlet request.

Parameters:
sr - The servlet request. Must not be null.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - If the servlet request is null.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The the servlet request method is not GET or POST, or the content type header value couldn't be parsed.
java.io.IOException - For a POST body that couldn't be read due to an I/O exception.

Parameters:
expectedMethod - The expected method. Must not be null.
Throws:
ParseException - If the method doesn't match the expected.

public void setContentType(java.lang.String ct)
                    throws ParseException
Sets the Content-Type header value.

Parameters:

Throws:
ParseException - If the header value couldn't be parsed.

ensureContentType

public void ensureContentType(javax.mail.internet.ContentType contentType)
                       throws ParseException
Ensures this HTTP request has the specified Content-Type header value. Note that this method compares only the primary type and subtype; any content type parameters, such as charset, are ignored.

Parameters:
contentType - The expected content type. Must not be null.
Throws:
ParseException - If the Content-Type header is missing or its primary and subtype doesn't match.

getAuthorization

public java.lang.String getAuthorization()
Gets the Authorization header value.

Returns:
The Authorization header value, null if not specified.

setAuthorization

public void setAuthorization(java.lang.String authz)
Sets the Authorization header value.

Parameters:
authz - The Authorization header value, null if not specified.

getQuery

public java.lang.String getQuery()
Gets the raw (undecoded) query string if the request is HTTP GET or the entity body if the request is HTTP POST.

Returns:
For HTTP GET requests the URL query string, for HTTP POST requests the body. null if not specified.

setQuery

public void setQuery(java.lang.String query)
Sets the raw (undecoded) query string if the request is HTTP GET or the entity body if the request is HTTP POST.

Parameters:
query - For HTTP GET requests the URL query string, for HTTP POST requests the body. null if not specified.

getQueryParameters

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getQueryParameters()
Gets the request query as a parameter map. The parameters are decoded according to application/x-www-form-urlencoded.

Returns:
The request query parameters, decoded. If none the map will be empty.
